item.title: Gladys West, mathematician whose work paved the way for GPS, dies at 95
item.description: A self-described "little farm girl" in the Jim Crow Era, Gladys West's complex and pioneering work for the U.S. Navy helped to improve billions of lives — and keep us from getting lost.

item.title: Are 'passkeys' better than passwords? This security expert says yes
item.description: Has your phone been prompting you for months to log into certain sites with a "passkey"? Security writer Kim Key of PC Mag explains why you might want to ditch your passwords in favor of passkeys.

item.title: They quit their day jobs to bet on current events. A look inside the prediction market mania
item.description: Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump's second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry's bonanza.
